revision.text:
{{EngvarB|date=December 2017}} {{Use dmy dates|date=December 2017}} {{Infobox person | image = Rob Beckett (comedian - Waffle TV).jpg | caption = Beckett at the [[Edinburgh Festival Fringe]] 2012 | name = Rob Beckett | birth_name = Robert Beckett | birth_date = {{birth date and age|df=y|1986|01|02}} | birth_place = [[Mottingham]], London, England | occupation = Comedian, presenter | television = ''[[I'm a Celebrity...Get Me Out of Here! NOW!]]''
''[[8 Out of 10 Cats]]''
''Wedding Day Winners''
''[[All Together Now (UK TV series)|All Together Now]]'' | spouse = Louise Watts (m. 2014) | children = 2 | website ={{url|robbeckettcomedy.com/}} }} '''Robert Beckett''' (born 2 January 1986){{Cite episode || title = Series 13, Episode 8 || episodelink = List of Mock the Week episodes#Series 13|| url = https://www.bbc.co.uk/iplayer/episode/b04hz9df/mock-the-week-series-13-episode-8 || accessdate = 22 September 2014 || network = BBC || date = 18 September 2014 || series = [[Mock the Week]] || seriesno = 13 || number = 8 || time = 11:30}} is an English stand-up comedian and presenter. He was a co-host on the [[ITV2]] spin-off show ''[[I'm a Celebrity...Get Me Out of Here! NOW!]]'' from 2012 to 2014. In September 2015 it was confirmed that Beckett would not return to the show. Since 2016, Beckett has been a team captain on the [[E4 (TV channel)|E4]] panel show ''[[8 Out of 10 Cats]]''. He presents [[BBC One]] entertainment series ''Wedding Day Winners'' and ''[[All Together Now (UK TV series)|All Together Now]]''. He is also set to host [[Channel 4]] video game show ''Rob Beckett's Playing for Time'' in 2018.{{cite web|url=http://www.chortle.co.uk/news/2018/02/11/39119/rob_beckett_to_front_video_game_show|title=Rob Beckett to front video game show : News 2018 : Chortle : The UK Comedy Guide|first=Powder Blue Internet Business|last=Solutions|website=www.chortle.co.uk}} ==Early life== Beckett was born in [[Mottingham, London|Mottingham]], London.{{cite web|url=http://www.newsshopper.co.uk/news/10657646.Mottingham_comedian_Rob_Beckett_chats_to_Vibe_ahead_of_UK_tour/|title=Mottingham comedian Rob Beckett chats to Vibe ahead of UK tour|author=Jim Palmer|date=5 September 2013}} He has four brothers. He went to [[Coopers School]] in [[Chislehurst]] with comedian [[Tom_Allen_(comedian)|Tom Allen]] . ==Career== Beckett started performing stand-up in 2009 and quickly enjoyed success in all of the new comedian competitions winning four in his first year.{{cn|date=October 2016}} His consistently impressive performances resulted in coming third in ''[[So You Think You're Funny]],''{{Cite web|url=http://soyouthinkyourefunny.co.uk/past-winners/sytyf-alumni/|title=Finalists & Runners up – So You Think You're Funny?|website=''soyouthinkyourefunny.co.uk''|access-date=8 July 2017}} and winning the Amused Moose Laugh-Off which earned him an invitation to perform at the [[Adelaide Fringe Festival]] in Australia.{{Cite web|url=https://www.amusedmoose.com/amused-moose-comedy-awards/amused-moose-laugh-off-2010/|title=AmusedMoose | Stand-up Comedy Soho Kings Cross Awards Courses|website=''amusedmoose.com''|accessdate=8 July 2017}} In [[Adelaide]], Beckett was nominated for the best newcomer award.{{cn|date=October 2016}} He made his debut at the [[Edinburgh Fringe Festival]] in 2012 with his solo show "Rob Beckett's Summer Holiday".{{Cite news|url=https://edinburghfestival.list.co.uk/article/43992-rob-becketts-summer-holiday/|title=Rob Beckett's Summer Holiday|date=3 August 2012|work=Edinburgh Festival|accessdate=8 July 2017}} In 2011, Beckett made a guest appearance as Mike in the [[Channel 4]] series ''[[Fresh Meat (TV series)|Fresh Meat]]''.{{cite web|url=https://www.imdb.com/name/nm1954673/|title=Rob Beckett|publisher=IMDb}} From 2012 until 2014, Beckett co-hosted ''[[I'm a Celebrity...Get Me Out of Here! NOW!]]'', the [[ITV2]] spin-off from the main show. He presented the show with [[Laura Whitmore]] and [[Joe Swash]].{{cite web|url=http://www.thesun.co.uk/sol/homepage/showbiz/tv/im_a__celebrity/4620419/Comic-Rob-Beckett-replaces-Russell-Kane-in-Im-A-Celebrity-spin-off-show.html|title=Comic Rob's job is to Kane it in the I'm A Celebrity jungle|date=1 November 2012}} He announced his departure from the show in October 2015, to concentrate on his tour. He was replaced by [[David Morgan (comedian)|David Morgan]]. Beckett has presented the ''Rock'N'Roll Football'' Sunday show on [[Absolute Radio]] since August 2014.{{cite web|url=http://absoluteradio.co.uk/presenters/rob-beckett-38/|title=Absolute Radio – Presenter Page – Rob Beckett|accessdate=1 November 2014}} Alongside fellow comedian [[Ian_Smith_(comedian)|Ian Smith]] and former footballer [[Jimmy Bullard]], Beckett hosts UK television channel [[Dave (TV channel)|Dave]]'s comedy-football podcast "The Magic Sponge" – an irreverent look at the lives of professional footballers.{{cite news | url=https://itunes.apple.com/gb/podcast/magic-sponge-jimmy-bullard/id1072130463?mt=2| title=The Magic Sponge }} He narrated the 2016 [[E4 (TV channel)|E4]] series ''[[Celebs Go Dating]]''.{{Cite news|url=http://www.ok.co.uk/tv/1011962/celebs-go-dating-who-is-narrator-rob-beckett-viewers-love-stephen-bear-ferne-mccann-e4|title=Celebs Go Dating viewers make confession about 'hilarious' narrator Rob Beckett|last=Donaldson|first=Laura|date=24 February 2017|work=OK!|access-date=9 July 2017}} In February 2017, the second series of Celebs Go Dating began airing with him writing and narrating once again, this time with some overseas celebrities in tow. Since 2016, Beckett has been a team captain on the [[More4]] panel show ''[[8 Out of 10 Cats]]''. [[Aisling Bea]] is the other team captain. Beckett was a regular contestant and eventual winner on the third series of ''[[Taskmaster (TV series)|Taskmaster]]'', which aired on October 2016. From 2018, he's presented ''Wedding Day Winners'', with [[Lorraine Kelly]]{{cite web|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/mediacentre/latestnews/2017/wedding-day-winners?ns_mchannel=social&ns_campaign=bbc_press_office&ns_source=twitter&ns_linkname=corporate|title=Lorraine Kelly and Rob Beckett say 'I do' to BBC One's Wedding Day Winners|publisher=BBC}} and ''All Together Now'' with [[Geri Horner]], both Saturday-night entertainment series for [[BBC One]].{{cite web|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/mediacentre/latestnews/2017/all-together-now?ns_mchannel=social&ns_campaign=bbc_press_office&ns_source=twitter&ns_linkname=corporate|title=Rob Beckett joins in with All Together Now on BBC One|publisher=BBC}} ==Filmography== {| class="wikitable" |- style="background:#b0c4de; text-align:center;" ! Year ! Title ! Role ! Channel ! Notes |- | 2012–2014 | ''[[I'm a Celebrity...Get Me Out of Here! NOW!]]'' | Co-presenter | [[ITV2]] | 3 series; with [[Joe Swash]] and [[Laura Whitmore]] |- | rowspan=2|2016— | ''[[Celebs Go Dating]]'' | Narrator | [[E4 (TV channel)|E4]] | 4 series |- | ''[[8 Out of 10 Cats]]'' | Team captain | [[More4]] | 2 series |- | rowspan=3|2017 | ''[[Comic Relief]]'' | Co-presenter | rowspan=5|[[BBC One]] | |- | ''[[The One Show]]'' | Guest presenter | 1 episode |- | ''[[Comedy Playhouse]]: Static'' | Rob | 1 episode |- | rowspan=3|2018 | ''Wedding Day Winners'' | Co-presenter | 1 series; with [[Lorraine Kelly]] |- | ''[[All Together Now (UK TV series)|All Together Now]]'' | Presenter | 1 series; with [[Geri Horner]] |- | ''Rob Beckett's Playing for Time'' | Presenter | [[Channel 4]] | |- |} ;Guest appearances *''[[Fresh Meat (TV series)|Fresh Meat]]'' (2011) – Guest appearance, as Mike *''[[Richard Bacon's Beer & Pizza Club]]'' (2011) – Guest *''[[8 Out of 10 Cats]]'' (2012, 2013, 2014) – Panellist *''[[8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown]]'' (2013, 2014, 2015, 2016) – Panellist & Dictionary Corner guest *''[[8 Out of 10 Cats]] Does Deal or No Deal'' (2013) – Box opener *''[[Fake Reaction]]'' (2013) – Panellist *''[[Celebrity Juice]]'' (2013, 2014) – Panellist *''[[Mock the Week]]'' (2013, 2014, 2015, 2016) – Panellist *''[[Sunday Side Up]]'' (2013) – Guest *''[[Sweat the Small Stuff]]'' (2013) – Panellist *''[[Live at the Apollo (TV series)|Live at the Apollo]]'' (2014) – Performer *''[[The Singer Takes It All]]'' (2014) – Guest *''[[Would I Lie to You? (TV series)|Would I Lie to You?]]'' (2014) – Panellist *''[[Celebrity Squares]]'' (2014) – Guest *''[[Never Mind the Buzzcocks]]'' (2014) – Panellist *''[[Play to the Whistle]]'' (2015, 2016, 2017) – Panellist *''[[The Cube (game show)|The Cube: Celebrity Special]]'' (2015) – Contestant *''[[Fifteen to One|Celebrity Fifteen to One]]'' (2015) – Contestant *''[[The Chase (UK game show)|The Chase: Celebrity Special]]'' (2016) – Contestant *''[[Insert Name Here]]'' ([[List of Insert Name Here episodes#Series 1 (2016)|2016]], [[List of Insert Name Here episodes#Series 2 (2017)|2017]]) – Panellist *''[[Taskmaster (TV series)|Taskmaster]]'' (2016) – Contestant *''[[Room 101 (TV series)|Room 101]]'' (2017) – Contestant *''[[Travel Man]]'' (2017) – Guest *''[[Dara O Briain's Go 8 Bit]]'' (2017) – Contestant ==Personal life== Beckett announced on a November 2014 episode of ''[[8 Out of 10 Cats]]'' that he had recently got married. {{Citation needed|date=August 2015}} In September 2016, Beckett announced on his YouTube channel that he recently had had a child.{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0PxrrNOJehE|title=I'm Older Than YouTube?! FIFA with Josh Widdicombe|last=Rob Beckett|date=9 September 2016|publisher=YouTube}} ==References== {{Reflist|2}} ==External links== *{{Official website|http://www.robbeckettcomedy.com/}} *{{IMDb name|1954673}} {{Absolute Radio|state=autocollapse}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Beckett, Rob}} [[Category:1986 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Comedians from London]] [[Category:English male comedians]]
